risk_factors: Mid-cap weakness during low-volume period signals potential distribution, not accumulation
Earnings revisions and margin compression in enterprise software and financial services could cascade
Geopolitical tensions (China PBOC warnings, U.S.-China relations) create volatility and risk-off rotation risk
Low-volume year-end conditions amplify price swings and reduce signal reliability
Bitcoin underperformance (down 7% YTD per Twitter) despite bullish promotion suggests sentiment-price disconnect
analysis.intraday_levels: SPY: Resistance at $700 (146k OI call wallâ€”active hedging). Support at $670 (45k OI, active delta hedging) and Max Pain $687. QQQ: Resistance cluster at $625â€“$630 (combined ~62k OI, both active). Watch for consolidation within these bands; breakout above $700 SPY would confirm bullish narrative, breakdown below $670 would favor bearish thesis.

QQQ: Upside $630â€“$640 (call walls); support $620 (max pain), then $590 (put wall). 1â€“5 day outlook leans bullish given active call wall hedging at SPY $700 and QQQ $630, but vulnerability emerges if daily closes below $670 SPY or $620 QQQ.
